key_points: Former Pennsylvania GOP Sen. Rick Santorum walked back comments he made last month about Native American culture in the United States.
Santorum claimed in April that there isn't much Native American culture in American culture.
His remarks were made during a speech at a conservative youth organization and were widely criticized.
CNN host Chris Cuomo invited Santorum to explain his comments on "Cuomo Prime Time."
Santorum said he misspoke and was referring to the founding of the country and its principles.
He acknowledged that Native Americans were here and had an impact on the country.
Santorum admitted that the way Native Americans were treated was "horrific."
Don Lemon, CNN anchor, expressed his fury over Santorum's explanation, criticizing him for not starting with an apology.
Critics accused Santorum of trying to erase diversity and downplay the atrocities committed against Native Americans.
Santorum's attempt to clarify his comments met with skepticism and further criticism.
spokespersons: Rick Santorum (former Pennsylvania GOP Sen., political commentator for CNN)
